verses.kjv: Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign, and reigned fifty and five years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Hephzibah.
verses.web: Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign, and he reigned fifty-five years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Hephzibah.
verses.ct: Manasseh was 12 years old when he became king, and he reigned 55 years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Hephzibah.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, after the abominations of the heathen, whom the LORD cast out before the children of Israel.
verses.web: He did that which was evil in LORD’s sight, after the abominations of the nations whom LORD cast out before the children of Israel.
verses.ct: He did what was evil in the sight of the LORD, following the detestable practices of the nations that the LORD had driven out before the people of Israel.

verses.kjv: For he built up again the high places which Hezekiah his father had destroyed; and he reared up altars for Baal, and made a grove, as did Ahab king of Israel; and worshipped all the host of heaven, and served them.
verses.web: For he built again the high places which Hezekiah his father had destroyed; and he raised up altars for Baal, and made an Asherah, as Ahab king of Israel did, and worshiped all the army of the sky, and served them.
verses.ct: He rebuilt the high places that his father Hezekiah had torn down. He set up altars for Baal and made an Asherah pole, just as King Ahab of Israel had done. He worshiped all the hosts of heaven and served them.

verses.kjv: And he built altars in the house of the LORD, of which the LORD said, In Jerusalem will I put my name.
verses.web: He built altars in LORD’s house, of which LORD said, “I will put my name in Jerusalem.”
verses.ct: He built altars in the house of the LORD, the place about which the LORD had said, "In Jerusalem I will put my name."

verses.kjv: And he built altars for all the host of heaven in the two courts of the house of the LORD.
verses.web: He built altars for all the army of the sky in the two courts of LORD’s house.
verses.ct: He built altars for all the hosts of heaven in the 2 courtyards of the house of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And he made his son pass through the fire, and observed times, and used enchantments, and dealt with familiar spirits and wizards: he wrought much wickedness in the sight of the LORD, to provoke him to anger.
verses.web: He made his son to pass through the fire, practiced sorcery, used enchantments, and dealt with those who had familiar spirits, and with wizards. He did much evil in LORD’s sight, to provoke him to anger.
verses.ct: He sacrificed his own son in the fire, practiced sorcery and divination, and consulted mediums and spiritists. He committed terrible evil in the sight of the LORD, provoking him to anger.

verses.kjv: And he set a graven image of the grove that he had made in the house, of which the LORD said to David, and to Solomon his son, In this house, and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all tribes of Israel, will I put my name for ever:
verses.web: He set the engraved image of Asherah that he had made in the house of which LORD said to David and to Solomon his son, “In this house, and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, I will put my name forever;
verses.ct: He placed the carved image of Asherah that he had made in the house of God — the house about which the LORD had told David and his son Solomon, "In this house and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen from all the tribes of Israel, I will put my name forever.

verses.kjv: Neither will I make the feet of Israel move any more out of the land which I gave their fathers; only if they will observe to do according to all that I have commanded them, and according to all the law that my servant Moses commanded them.
verses.web: I will not cause the feet of Israel to wander any more out of the land which I gave their fathers, if only they will observe to do according to all that I have commanded them, and according to all the law that my servant Moses commanded them.”
verses.ct: I will never again cause Israel's feet to wander from the land I gave their ancestors — if only they will be careful to obey everything I have commanded them and the entire law that my servant Moses gave them."

verses.kjv: But they hearkened not: and Manasseh seduced them to do more evil than did the nations whom the LORD destroyed before the children of Israel.
verses.web: But they didn’t listen, and Manasseh seduced them to do that which is evil more than the nations did whom LORD destroyed before the children of Israel.
verses.ct: But the people did not listen. Manasseh led them astray to do even more evil than the nations the LORD had destroyed before the people of Israel.

verses.kjv: And the LORD spake by his servants the prophets, saying,
verses.web: LORD spoke by his servants the prophets, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke through his servants the prophets, saying,

verses.kjv: Because Manasseh king of Judah hath done these abominations, and hath done wickedly above all that the Amorites did, which were before him, and hath made Judah also to sin with his idols:
verses.web: “Because Manasseh king of Judah has done these abominations, and has done wickedly above all that the Amorites did, who were before him, and has also made Judah to sin with his idols;
verses.ct: "Because King Manasseh of Judah has committed these detestable acts — acting more wickedly than the Amorites who came before him — and has led Judah into sin with his idols,

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Behold, I am bringing such evil upon Jerusalem and Judah, that whosoever heareth of it, both his ears shall tingle.
verses.web: therefore LORD the God of Israel says, ‘Behold, I bring such evil on Jerusalem and Judah that whoever hears of it, both his ears will tingle.
verses.ct: this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: 'I am about to bring such disaster on Jerusalem and Judah that the ears of everyone who hears about it will ring.

verses.kjv: And I will stretch over Jerusalem the line of Samaria, and the plummet of the house of Ahab: and I will wipe Jerusalem as a man wipeth a dish, wiping it, and turning it upside down.
verses.web: I will stretch over Jerusalem the line of Samaria, and the plummet of Ahab’s house; and I will wipe Jerusalem as a man wipes a dish, wiping it and turning it upside down.
verses.ct: I will stretch over Jerusalem the same measuring line used against Samaria and the same plumb line used against the house of Ahab. I will wipe out Jerusalem as someone wipes a dish — wiping it clean and turning it upside down.

verses.kjv: And I will forsake the remnant of mine inheritance, and deliver them into the hand of their enemies; and they shall become a prey and a spoil to all their enemies;
verses.web: I will cast off the remnant of my inheritance, and deliver them into the hands of their enemies. They will become a prey and a plunder to all their enemies,
verses.ct: I will abandon the remnant of my inheritance and hand them over to their enemies. They will become plunder and prey for all their enemies,

verses.kjv: Because they have done that which was evil in my sight, and have provoked me to anger, since the day their fathers came forth out of Egypt, even unto this day.
verses.web: because they have done that which is evil in my sight, and have provoked me to anger, since the day their fathers came out of Egypt, even to this day.’ ”
verses.ct: because they have done what is evil in my sight and have provoked me to anger from the day their ancestors came out of Egypt until this very day.'"

verses.kjv: Moreover Manasseh shed innocent blood very much, till he had filled Jerusalem from one end to another; beside his sin wherewith he made Judah to sin, in doing that which was evil in the sight of the LORD.
verses.web: Moreover Manasseh shed innocent blood very much, until he had filled Jerusalem from one end to another; in addition to his sin with which he made Judah to sin, in doing that which was evil in LORD’s sight.
verses.ct: Beyond all this, Manasseh shed so much innocent blood that he filled Jerusalem with it from one end to the other — in addition to the sin he caused Judah to commit by doing what was evil in the sight of the LORD.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh, and all that he did, and his sin that he sinned, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh, and all that he did, and his sin that he sinned, aren’t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.ct: As for the rest of Manasseh's deeds, everything he did, and the sin he committed — are they not recorded in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

verses.kjv: And Manasseh slept with his fathers, and was buried in the garden of his own house, in the garden of Uzza: and Amon his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: Manasseh slept with his fathers, and was buried in the garden of his own house, in the garden of Uzza; and Amon his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Manasseh died and was buried in the garden of his own palace, in the garden of Uzza. His son Amon became king in his place.

verses.kjv: Amon was twenty and two years old when he began to reign, and he reigned two years in Jerusalem. And his mother’s name was Meshullemeth, the daughter of Haruz of Jotbah.
verses.web: Amon was twenty-two years old when he began to reign; and he reigned two years in Jerusalem. His mother’s name was Meshullemeth the daughter of Haruz of Jotbah.
verses.ct: Amon was 22 years old when he became king, and he reigned 2 years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Meshullemeth daughter of Haruz, from Jotbah.

verses.kjv: And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, as his father Manasseh did.
verses.web: He did that which was evil in LORD’s sight, as Manasseh his father did.
verses.ct: He did what was evil in the sight of the LORD, just as his father Manasseh had done.

verses.kjv: And he walked in all the way that his father walked in, and served the idols that his father served, and worshipped them:
verses.web: He walked in all the ways that his father walked in, and served the idols that his father served, and worshiped them;
verses.ct: He followed every path his father had walked, serving and worshiping the same idols his father had served.

verses.kjv: And he forsook the LORD God of his fathers, and walked not in the way of the LORD.
verses.web: and he abandoned LORD, the God of his fathers, and didn’t walk in the way of LORD.
verses.ct: He abandoned the LORD, the God of his ancestors, and refused to walk in the way of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the servants of Amon conspired against him, and slew the king in his own house.
verses.web: The servants of Amon conspired against him, and put the king to death in his own house.
verses.ct: Amon's own officials conspired against him and assassinated the king in his own palace.

verses.kjv: And the people of the land slew all them that had conspired against king Amon; and the people of the land made Josiah his son king in his stead.
verses.web: But the people of the land killed all those who had conspired against king Amon; and the people of the land made Josiah his son king in his place.
verses.ct: But the people of the land executed all those who had conspired against King Amon, and they made his son Josiah king in his place.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Amon which he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Amon which he did, aren’t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.ct: As for the rest of Amon's deeds and what he did — are they not recorded in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

verses.kjv: And he was buried in his sepulchre in the garden of Uzza: and Josiah his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: He was buried in his tomb in the garden of Uzza, and Josiah his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: He was buried in his tomb in the garden of Uzza, and his son Josiah became king in his place.
